result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca Lynn Palmieri

defendant.name: Palmieri, Rebecca Lynn
defendant.address: 4730 State Hwy 73 South, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rebecca Lynn Palmieri in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CM128 and 16CM274.

8:38 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM274:
Count 1 - Guilty

16CM128:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 16CM274 and Count 1 of 16CM128 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Arendt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CM274:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 30 day jail sentence
15 days pre-trial incarceration credit
If probation revoked, eligible for huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
Placed on Probation for 12 months:
**Conditions of Probation -
Comply with the requirements of Wood County Drug Court 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide DNA Sample 

16CM128:
Count 1 - DRI
filed bythe State
